poem:
**The Gap**

In the urban echo,
     where steel serpents hiss,
I fell into the mouth of 
     time's narrow abyss.

Faces blurred by shock,
     my form entrapped—
A twitch of fate's
     caustic clasp.

Bodies watched in silence,
     my mortal coil compressed—
Life's breath suspended,
     death gently caressed.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "A moment that changed me: My body was wedged between the train and platform – and my mortality rushed towards me The first feeling was embarrassment. What had happened was yet to catch up with me. All I knew was that I was looking into an open carriage, my body wedged into the gap between the tube and the platform, while strangers were staring from their seats in shock. It was 2015. I was 20". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
